title: Aurelion Sol is probably going to be very annoying on ARAM
body: I was watching NightBlue play aussie last night then something hit me.  If someone gets him on ARAM it's going to be spirit bomb... spirit bomb... spirit bomb... all bloody match.

replies.body:
ARAM is already hilariously broken. It's just business as usual!

(Before y'all go on throwing rotten fruit at me, I actually _like_ ARAM. I play it pretty frequently. But only crazy folk would argue it's fair and balanced.)

75% of the match is pure luck from the champion lobby.
25% of the match is skill
That's half the charm. You can play casually knowing that if your team is doing poorly, odds are it was decided in champ select by the RNG and therefore not entirely your fault.

You'd think that would be half the charm, but when you somehow go 7 matches getting bad picks while the other team keeps getting {{champion:99}} {{champion:17}} and {{champion:110}}, that actually becomes really frustrating. Still, I believe a cheap fix would be to let people get re-rolls through the hextech crafting mechanic.
Part of that is ARAM accounts.
or maybe make it truly random and make it so EVERY champ is avalible to play on the map...
Also a good idea. Riot could implement both of these things and simultaneously get rid of people making aram only accounts and allow for more opportunities to gain rerolls.

none of these champions bother me in aram. In fact they are a bit overrated. {{champion:37}} ,{{champion:113}} {{champion:26}} , THESE are the really scary aram champs.

and zyra, ofc

{{champion:37}}  is arguably the most OP ARAM champ. I used to main her, so I pay special attention to how I do with her. I've yet to lose a single ARAM match as Sona despite trading for her whenever I get the chance.
Funny, because I haven't seen a Sona win a game on Howling Abyss in almost a dozen matches now.  It's gotten to the point where I have to reroll her or dodge because I know we're going to lose.

Those are just the ones that I notice are always on the enemy team in matches I lose (and qute frankly do find a pain to deal with). Everyone has their own champs they can't stand on aram. Like how {{champion:268}} might not bother some people but others would immediately dodge if they knew he was on the other team ahead of time.
I got an entire AP team once, with 4 supports and a Vlad against a complete tank team. Best game of my life, we lost ofc, but the clutch saves were awesome

I don't understand why they don't just put a little bit of work into balancing the random champ selection.  It wouldn't be that hard to generate more even teams.  I play ARAMs a lot when I don't have the time for a SR game, but it's quite frustrating when you know you have no chance from the get-go.
